description.narrative: FSP-C-SAP 1 Strengthening coordinated approaches to reduce invasive alien species (IAS) threats to globally significant agrobiodiversity and agroecosystems in China
seat of a first-order administrative division
seat of a first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Indicator 1: Area of landscape under improved IAS prevention, control and management practices (hectares) Indicator 2: Number of direct beneficiaries disaggregated by gender as a co-benefit of GEF investment Indicator 3: Extent of strategies/regulations for comprehensive IAS prevention, control and management adoption which have addressed identified barriers and gaps, as measured by: ia) The National IAS Strategic Action Plan developed. ib) The Provincial IAS Strategy and Action Plans in Hainan and Chongqing)adopted. iia) Number of new or updated Ministerial IAS prevention, control and management regulations improved iib) Number of new or updated Provincial Department IAS prevention, control and management regulations developed Indicator 4: Number of budget-supported local IAS coordination bodies or IAS offices that regularly coordinate local inter-sectoral IAS Management, including implementation of the developed strategic action plan : i). Chongqing ii) Hainan. Indicator 5: Government financing for the prevention, control and management of IAS threats, as measured by annual operating budget provided by the financial department of: i) MARA. ii) MEE. iii) GACC. Indicator 6: Institutional capacities and interagency response mechanisms for IAS protection, control and management including detection, quarantine, disposal, monitoring early warning and rapid response, as indicated by the UNDP capacity scorecard: i) National ii) Chongqing iii) Hainan iv) Bishan v) Wenchang Indicator 7: Staff capacity at Yangpu port for inspection, detection and species identification, quarantine and destruction of IAS at demonstration port, as measured by PPG developed port capacity scorecard. Indicator 8: Number people at national, provincial and county levels staff (gender and youth disaggregated) obtaining certificates for successful completion of comprehensive and specialized trainings on IAS prevention, control and management delivered by certified training entities Ind

comment.narrative: To strengthen intersectoral coordination mechanisms, approaches and technical capacity for more effective prevention, control and management of IAS threats to agrobiodiversity in China.

Activity1.1.1 Establish and operationalize the National IAS Coordination Group* Activity1.1.2. Create and run Provincial IAS Management Coordinating Groups in Hainan and Chongqing * Activity1.1.3. Create and run County IAS Management Coordinating Groups in Wenchang and Bishan* Activity1.1.4. Hold annual multi-sector coordination seminars Activities1.1.5 Workshops and meetings for MEE led activities Activity 1.2.1a.Improve the national regulation framework to optimize cross-sectoral IAS Management Activity 1.2.1c.Improve the national regulation framework to optimize cross-sectoral IAS Management Activity1.2.2. Develop provincial regulation for IAS prevention, control and management in Hainan and Chongqing Activity1.2.2c. Develop provincial regulation for IAS prevention, control and management in Hainan and Chongqing Activity 1.2.3a. Revise IAS Early Warning Guidelines Activity 1.2.3c. Revise IAS Early Warning Guidelines Activity 1.2.4. Revise IAS rapid response guidelines Activity 1.2.5. Develop an IAS Biodiversity Risk Assessment Guideline Activity1.2.6 Develop IAS buffer zone guideline for areas surrounding ecological functioning zones and protected areas Activity1.2.7. Develop IAS Biodiversity Risk Assessment, Early Warning and Rapid Response guidelines for protected areas. Activity1.2.8. Include biodiversity in the biennial updates of the “First Priority” IAS species list. Activity1.2.9. Include biodiversity in the updating of the 2007 National Quarantine Pest list. Activity1.2.10 Environmental sector IAS policy making, planning and coordination between sectors Activity1.2.11 Travel for pilot investigation and paticipation for workshops Activity1.3.1 Develop the strategic vision and content of the National IAS Management Strategy and Action Plan (IAS NSAP 2021-2030) Activity1.3.2. Prepare the National IAS Management strategy and action plan (IAS NSAP 2021-2030) Activity1.3.2c. Prepare the National IAS Management strategy and action plan (IAS NSAP 2021-2030) Activity1.3.3. Prepare Provincial IAS Management Strategy and Action Plan (IAS PSAP 2022-2030) for Hainan and Chongqing Activity1.3.3c. Prepare Provincial IAS Management Strategy and Action Plan (IAS PSAP 2022-2030) for Hainan and Chongqing Activity1.3.4 National Technical Advisor Activity1.3.5 C-SAP Chief Technical Advisor Activity1.4.1a. Develop sectoral/ministerial Implementation Plans for the IAS NSAP 2021-2030. Activity 1.4.1b Develop MEE Implementation Plans for the IAS NSAP 2021-2030 Activity1.4.1c. Develop sectoral/ministerial Implementation Plans for the IAS NSAP 2021-2030. Activity 1.4.2a. Develop sectoral/department Implementation Plans for the IAS PSAP 2022-2030 in Hainan and Chongqing. Activity 1.4.2c. Develop sectoral/department Implementation Plans for the IAS PSAP 2022-2030 in Hainan and Chongqing. Activity1.4.4 consultant for GACC policy

1. Strengthened the Enabling Environment a) Coordination mechanism is established and run well at national level and progressed well on provincial/municipal and county levels, which is a big support to project implementation. b) Baseline studies on national and provincial IAS regulatory framework were progressed well. These studies will optimize cross-sectoral IAS Management, pave way for the development of IAS strategy and expand the scope and intensity of IAS port quarantine. c) Baseline studies on strategic plans and for IAS NASP 2021-2030 were started. The results will not only be formulated basis on the plan but also provide direction for the preparation of IAS PSAP 2022-2030 in order to increase applicability d) The Plan for further Strengthening the Prevention and Control of IAS was approved and issued by the ministries of MARA, MEE, GACC, MNR and NFGA jointly, which proposed the target of IAS Prevention and Control in 2025 and 2035. The responsibilities and main tasks of each department have been clarified, which will guide the IAS management for different sectors. 2. Comprehensive IAS management frameworks and strengthened institutional capacity a) The development of Methodologies for risk assessment, early warning and rapid response to IAS were started. And relevant documents will help to improve IAS Early Warning of Hainan. b) The existing standard and specifications on IAS inspection, detection, quarantine, and disposal were collected and made preparation for updating these specifications. And corresponding quarantine management measures were put forward accordingly. c) The preparation of training courses was under way. 3. Demonstration of IAS threat reduction in agroecosystems Field visit and baseline survey to project sites for smooth and solid project implementation in the coming days. These research collected data related to the number, distribution range, occurrence area, and damage brought by agricultural IAS within the pilot area, identified the target IAS and the core demo areas and analyze the impact of IAS on the local economy, ecology and society. 4. Awareness raising, knowledge management and coordination A series of online and offline activities were carried out to promote IAS prevention and control knowledge. The results will help participants have a deeper understanding of relevant policies, professional knowledge and skills.

Output 1.1 Inter-agency coordination mechanisms are established to support IAS strategic plan implementation and improve the management of IAS threats to agrobiodiversity. • The Activity 1.1.1 was started. The composition of National IAS Coordination Group has been discussed with different sector and national consultants, the draft suggestion was developed.
• In 2020, baseline study on activity 1.2.5 was started. A technical guideline for assessment of environmental risk of Alien species distributed in 2012 was evaluated, and gaps between baseline and project activity was estimated. The new guideline will add contents on production, economy, social and health.
• In 2020, baseline study on Activity 1.2.7 was started. A technical guideline for assessing the impacts of alien invasive plants on plant diversity in nature reserves was evaluated against the requirements of the activity. Gaps were identified between the technical guideline and practical operational guideline required by the activity. A more detailed practical guideline for staff working in nature reserves (protected area) is required to be prepared.
• Under Activity1.3.4&Activity1.3.5 the National Technical Advisor and C-SAP Technical Advisor was recruited in October. They were cooperated with CTA to review the approved project document and its annexes, the related documents prepared during the project PPG phase, to clarify the roles and responsibilities of various team members for achieving the project results, budget allocation, monitoring and evaluation plan to link the measurable indicators in output and outcome levels, and the project reporting mechanism.
• In 2020, the implementing measure for activity 1.4.1b was studied and discussed within MEE. Baseline and relationship between IAS NSAP and the newly updated NBASP was studied, and a more detailed IAS NSAP was identified to be prepared.
• Consultant for GACC policy was recruited.
Communication between different sectors and specialists from different scoters was important to collecting information and understanding the requirements of policy-making.
Inception workshop and1st PSC meeting of C-SAP 2 IAS project was held on Nov 18th, 2020, to officially launch the project and provide opportunity to gather suggestions and comments from stakeholders to finalize the Two-Year Work Plan (TYWP).PMO have coordinated with MEE and GACC for the revision and improvement of 2020-2021 TYWP and finished the signature in early December and applied for the first advancement in time. MARA received the first advancement December 14, 2020.Whilst the financial account was closed by Dec. 15 2020 annual fiscal year, resulting planned budget has not be spent up and the low delivery for the first year. In particular, the project activities are proceeding normally and have not been affected by late payment of funds. It will try to promote project implementation in accordance with the TYWP and proceed the reimbursement in 2021. 11,300
3,300
On track
Activity1.1.1 Establish and operationalize the National IAS Coordination Group* Output 1.2 Regulatory framework to strengthened management of IAS and their negative impacts on agrobiodiversity are reviewed and revised/ developed at the national level and in target provinces to provide protection of agrobiodiversity. Activity 1.2.5 Develop an IAS Biodiversity Risk Assessment Guideline Activity 1.2.7. Develop IAS Biodiversity Risk Assessment, Early Warning and Rapid Response guidelines for protected areas. Output 1.3 Strategic plans for IAS are developed at national and provincial level defining common targets and actions and clarifying the responsibilities of agencies involved in IAS management, including roles related to agrobiodiversity conservation.
Activity1.3.4 National Technical Advisor Activity1.3.5 C-SAP Chief Technical Advisor Output 1.4 Sectoral plans are revised to align with the national IAS strategic plan and updated regulations, mainstreaming relevant actions, indicators and targets to address IAS threats to agroecosystems. Activity 1.4.1b Promote to develop MEE Implementation Plans for the IAS NSAP 2021-2030 Activity1.4.4 consultant for GACC policy
Output 2.1 Methodologies for risk assessment, early warning and rapid response to IAS incursions in agroecosystems are developed and used. • In 2020, discussion about the implementation of activity 2.1.1 and 2.1.2 was conducted on line between MEE and Hainan EEB. Participation of Hainan provincial government on the activity was acknowledged. Outputs completed related to the activity should be considered when making implementation plans. 0 0 On track
Activity 2.1.1. Develop provincial IAS Biodiversity Risk Assessment Methodologies in Hainan. Activity 2.1.2. Undertake an IAS Biodiversity Risk Assessment for Hainan.
Output 3.3 Improved understanding of IAS distribution and impacts on agrobiodiversity, at two agriculture landscapes through targeted and management-oriented surveys and assessments. • In 2020, implementation of the activity 3.3.2 &3.3.3b&3.3.4b and expected outcomes were discussed between MEE/FECO and academies. Activities should be designed based on budgets available. 0 0 On track
Activities 3.3.2 Design the IAS distribution survey and IAS impact assessment of selected main IAS in a representative protected area. Activities 3.3.3b. Undertake the IAS distribution survey and IAS impact assessment in a representative protected area. 3.3.4b. Formulate the IAS distribution survey and IAS impact assessment reports for the representative protected area
Output 4.4 A Program Coordination, Monitoring and Evaluation Plan is developed, adopted and effectively implemented. • Under Activity 4.4.1&4.4.9, Inception workshop and 1st PSC meeting of C-SAP Program was held on Nov 18th, 2020, about 50 persons from three GEF Agencies and the national and sub national implementing partners, PSC members and multi-stakeholders participated the workshop, and review the Program framework, management arrangement, coordination mechanism and the contribution of child projects to C-SAP Program target, and has approved by PSC. The meeting identify the 2nd C-SAP Program PSC will be undertaken by C-SAP 3 Hainan project.
• For implementation of Activity 4.4.2 and Activity4.4.8, Inception workshop and1st PSC meeting of C-SAP 2 IAS project was held on Nov 18th, 2020, about 50 persons from PSC member, PMO, multi-stakeholders participated the workshop, to officially launch the project and provide opportunity to gather suggestions and comments from stakeholders to finalize the Two-Year Work Plan (TYWP).
• Establish the C-SAP2 IAS Project Steering Committee, which provides advice for Project implementation. The Deputy Director General of Department of Science, Technology and Education, MARA is the chair of the PSC, and the other 8 members come from relevant development partners and beneficiary representatives. All the members of C-SAP 2 IAS will meet once a year at least.
• Under Activity 4.4.9, C-SAP Program Steering Committee was established, which provides advices and guides for program implementation. The Deputy Director General of Department of Science, Technology and Education, MARA is the chair of the PSC, and the other 11 members come from relevant development partners and beneficiary representatives. All the members of C-SAP PSC will meet once a year at least.
• Activity4.4.10 Technical C-SAP Program Advisor was recruited in October. Since the inception workshop and 1st PSC meeting was held by the end of the year, the meeting expenses were not reimbursed in time because the financial account was closed, thus the 2020 budget could only be postponed to 2021. It is not recommended to hold meetings or training at the end of the year. 15,800 0 Achieved
Activity4.4.1. Hold program inception workshops
Activity 4.4.2. Hold project inception workshops
Activity4.4.8. Hold C-SAP 2 IAS project Steering Committee meetings
Activity4.4.9. Organize annual C-SAP program steering committee meetings and host one of them Activity4.4.10 Technical C-SAP Program Advisor
